title: JSON Schema Definitions File.
description: This file is used for declaring definitions that are referenced from other schemas

regex.description: Perform regular expression search using ``re.search`` python module on stdout/stderr stream for reporting if test ``PASS``.

stream.description: The stream field can be stdout or stderr. buildtest will read the output or error stream after completion of test and check if regex matches in stream

exp.description: Specify a regular expression to run with input stream specified by ``stream`` field. buildtest uses re.search when performing regex

env.description: One or more key value pairs for an environment (key=value)

description.description: The ``description`` field is used to document what the test is doing

tags.description: Classify tests using a tag name, this can be used for categorizing test and building tests using ``--tags`` option

skip.description: The ``skip`` is a boolean field that can be used to skip tests during builds. By default buildtest will build and run all tests in your buildspec file, if ``skip: True`` is set it will skip the buildspec.

executor.description: Select one of the executor name defined in your configuration file (``config.yml``). Every buildspec must have an executor which is responsible for running job.

vars.description: Assign value to metric based on variable name

env.description: Assign value to metric based on environment variable

metrics.description: This field is used for defining one or more metrics that is recorded for each test. A metric must have a unique name which is recorded in the test metadata.

status.description: The status section describes how buildtest detects PASS/FAIL on test. By default returncode 0 is a PASS and anything else is a FAIL, however buildtest can support other types of PASS/FAIL conditions.

slurm_job_state.description: This field can be used for checking Slurm Job State, if there is a match buildtest will report as ``PASS``

returncode.description: Specify a list of returncodes to match with script's exit code. buildtest will PASS test if script's exit code is found in list of returncodes. You must specify unique numbers as list and a minimum of 1 item in array

regex.description: Determine state (PASS/FAIL) of test based on regular expression on output or error stream

runtime.description: The runtime section will pass test based on min and max values and compare with actual runtime.

min.description: Specify a minimum runtime in seconds. The test will PASS if actual runtime exceeds min time.

max.description: Specify a maximum runtime in seconds. The test will PASS if actual runtime is less than max time

state.description: explicitly mark state of test regardless of status calculation

BB.description: Create burst buffer space, this specifies #BB options in your test.

DW.description: Specify Data Warp option (#DW) when using burst buffer.

sbatch.description: This field is used for specifying #SBATCH options in test script.

bsub.description: This field is used for specifying #BSUB options in test script.

cobalt.description: This field is used for specifying #COBALT options in test script.

pbs.description: This field is used for specifying #PBS directives in test script.

patternProperties.description: Name of executor to override configuration

cppflags.description: Set C or C++ preprocessor flags

run.description: Specify a series of commands to run.
